formattedAddress: 499 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 499 E 34th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Truly one of the best customer experience ever. We booked a flight for my family who were coming on different planes – the driver was able to pick them up from different terminals and was very accommodating. Unfortunately one passenger got stuck in customs for 3h but the Blade team was able to rebook them on a later flight while helping the other passengers get on an earlier flight. The customer service team was very responsive and shared updates every 30mn. I felt that my family was in safe, capable hands at all times and they of course loved the flight experience.

originalText.text: Absolutely stunning experience that is quite expensive but well worth it and makes getting to and from EWR extremely fast and convenient. Super friendly staff from one direction to the other and a great way to get a inexpensive helicopter tour of the city. Stunning and beautiful views of the tarmac at Newark airport along with great views of the Statue of Liberty from above. Seeing the NY skyline from the helicopter is an experience that will not be forgotten.

text.text: Absolutely stunning experience that is quite expensive but well worth it and makes getting to and from EWR extremely fast and convenient. originalText.text: The receptionist was very rude. I brought a carry-on to take to the Hamptons and she took one look at me, didn’t even smile and said “our customers who fly with us to the Hamptons don’t usually bring luggage on board.” I looked over and saw a bunch of tagged carry-ons, which belonged to the other passengers and was thinking, why is she singling me out? Apparently people do, otherwise you wouldn’t have the information about weight requirements for luggage on your website. I spent over $2K on roundtrip flights. I expected better service than this. I was thinking about booking a lot more flights and this person made me feel un-welcomed because I didn’t fit the mold of a typical passenger that goes to the Hamptons. Shame on her.

originalText.text: Blade is the worst business in NYC. They dump massive amounts of pollution via their leaded fuel guzzling helicopters. These helicopters range in age from a quarter century old to nearly half century old relics. Not only is the pollution a big problem, but Blade’s pilots routinely fly below the minimum altitude set by the FAA for safely flying over populated areas, ie NYC leading to unbearable noise and vibration. They cater to their wealthy passengers at the expense of the residents of every borough in NYC. Eventually Blade must be legislated out of existence. The noise and pollution they cause are devastating to the health and well being of the people in our communities. Not to mention our air quality. Today, there were 55 overflights over my home in 12 hours. How this was ever approved is anyone’s guess. ($$?) What’s the point of 311 noise complaints?

originalText.text: The service is fantastic and it made going to the airport such a pleasant experience. Will definitely be doing it again
